summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon Wireless, seeking telephone records for the period January 1, 2003 through August 1, 2006, as part of an investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the cover letter requesting Verizon Wireless to refrain from disclosing the existence of the grand jury subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated May 2, 2019, which requests specified records from Verizon Wireless.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Verizon Records
events.description: The subpoena commands Verizon Wireless to appear before the grand jury to produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Time Period for Requested Telephone Records
events.description: The subpoena requests all records for specified telephone numbers for this time period, indicating the investigation focuses on activities during these years.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, New York
180 Washington Valley Road, Bedminster, NJ 07921 (Verizon Wireless address)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity).
The investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, specifically by the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force.

The subpoena seeks extensive telephone records from Verizon Wireless for the period January 1, 2003, through August 1, 2006, including call details, subscriber information, text messages, and IP history.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality and prevent interference.
The document does not list specific telephone numbers or names of targets, indicating the rider with those details is likely attached but not included in this excerpt.
